abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project is a credit program
            to promote greater private sector participation in
            modernization of the food distribution system. The project
            would support development-oriented subprojects for improving
            marketing facilities at the producer, wholesaler and
            retailer levels. It would also help integration and
            coordination of various marketing activities. Investments
            would allow adoption of modern technologies of handling,
            packaging and delivering perishable products that would
            reduce product losses and costs, as well as improve the
            quality of products delivered to consumers. The proposed
            project would be implemented over a two-and-a-half year period.
